column4: Hello everyone. I just installed 11.04 and it does not seem to recognise my cd-rom at all. Any thoughts?
What type of CDROM is it?  IDE?  or...?
Is this a desktop computer or laptop or...?
or just tell us what   ls -l /dev/cdrom    says.
Well, I don't know.  You might reboot and see if it comes up.
Could be that your video card is overheating.
Maybe your PC needs a good cleaning?
is there some way to check if it's overheating? and by cleaning do you mean like physically with alcohol or something, or cleaning up files and things
I mean physical cleaning.  Is this a Desktop or Laptop computer?
Yea, the motherboard could be overheating.
But that is just one of several possibilities, but is the most-likely one.
what is a way to solve that? not running two OS?
